course.title: Urban America
course.description: This course addresses questions about the past and present urban experience by analyzing American cities from various disciplinary perspectives. Unit I hones critical skills through close readings of How the Other Half Lives, an expose of late nineteenth-century New York. Unit II emphasizes the importance of context through analysis of the play, A Raisin in the Sun with companion texts. Unit III teaches the fundamentals of research through independent projects on our local, urban environment: Cambridge, Massachusetts. Together, these units teach the mechanics of academic writing while providing insight into the problems and promise of the American city over time.
